entry.title: Dolwyddelan Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Dolwyddelan Castle (pictured) was captured in January 1283, its new garrison was equipped with winter camouflage of white material and stockings?

entry.title: David Webber (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that former basketball player David Webber broke a record previously held by all-time great Larry Bird?

entry.title: Youth in the Shade (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "In Bloom", the lead single of the EP Youth in the Shade, samples A-ha's 1984 single "Take On Me"?

entry.title: Misuzu Yamada (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Misuzu Yamada worked as a nursery teacher before starting her voice-acting career?

entry.title: a Nebraska public radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Nebraska public radio station operated from a 1916-built Carnegie library in the 1970s and 1980s?

entry.title: Vanille (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to artist Tetsuya Nomura, Vanille's attire took inspiration from the Himba people of Namibia?

entry.title: Soviet Union boycotted the United Nations (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Soviet Union boycotted the United Nations in 1950?

entry.title: a book (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nickelodeon storyboard artists created a book with hundreds of pornographic drawings of SpongeBob SquarePants characters?
